<<<code>>>: Bitmap scaledBitmap = Bitmap.createScaledBitmap(bitmap, newWidth, newHeight, true);
<<<explanation>>>: The method `createScaledBitmap` is used to resize the bitmap. The first parameter is the original bitmap, the second and third parameters are the new width and height respectively. The fourth parameter is a boolean that decides whether to filter pixels or not. If set to true, it will filter pixels, otherwise it will use the nearest neighbor algorithm.

The new width and height can be calculated as follows:
```java
int targetWidth = yourDesiredWidth;
int targetHeight = (int)(bitmap.getHeight() * (targetWidth / (float)bitmap.getWidth()));
```
In your case, you want to set the height and have the width automatically calculated. So you would do something like this:
```java
int targetHeight = yourDesiredHeight;
int targetWidth = (int)(bitmap.getWidth() * (targetHeight / (float)bitmap.getHeight()));
Bitmap scaledBitmap = Bitmap.createScaledBitmap(bitmap, targetWidth, targetHeight, true);
image_projet.setImageBitmap(scaledBitmap);
```
This will resize the bitmap to have the desired height and automatically calculate the width proportionally.

Please note that this code assumes that the original bitmap is not null and that the desired height is greater than 0. You may want to add error checking to handle these cases.
